required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Ambulatory Respiratory Tract Infection Survey, Burden of Respiratory Syncitial Virus in the Era of Covid-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Association Clinique Thérapeutique Infantile du val de Marne

clinical_study.source: Association Clinique Thérapeutique Infantile du val de Marne

brief_summary.textblock: Strengthening outpatient low respiratory tract infection surveillance to document the burden of Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV)

detailed_description.textblock: The study protocol is designed with three key components: 1. Build on existing PARI outpatient syndromic surveillance by adding laboratory multiplex testing of LRTI samples (RSV, Influenza, SARS-COV-2) 2. Follow all bronchiolitis through the PARI RWE database and document "patient journey" for 5 years after first medical visit 3. Review the electronic PARI data of three previous seasons in order to document the impact of LRTI attributable to RSV in children < 2 years in France prior to enhanced surveillance

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with proven RSV disease (bronchiolitis, AOM or pneumonia)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Respiratory Tract Infections by RSV Status
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with Respiratory Tract Infections by RSV Status

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Respiratory Tract Infections with SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with Respiratory Tract Infections with SARS-CoV-2

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of associated complications by RSV status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day of enrrollement, 15 days and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with associated complications by RSV status

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of AOM by RSV status
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with AOM by RSV status

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of pneumonia by RSV status
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of children with pneumonia by RSV status
Assessed by the quality of life infant scale (from 0-100, so that higher scores indicate better Health-Related Quality of Life)

Sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value positive and negative likelihood ratio of the SARS-Cov2, influenza A/B and RSV rapid antigenic test compared to the reference test by multiplex RT-PCR

arm_group.description: - children under 24 months of age (≤) with First episode of bronchiolitis
define with Paradise Criteria) or otorrhea
defined by the presence of opacity of parenchymal condensation and/or pleural effusion on chest X-ray associated with fever

intervention.description: rapid antigen test for Sars Cov-2, influenza and RSV. RT-PCR for a subgroup of 400 patients

biospec_descr.textblock: Nasopharyngeal samples : rapid antigen test: Sars cov2, influenza and RSV

study_pop.textblock: children under 24 months old with first episode of bronchiolitis or acute otitis media or pneumonia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children under 24 months of age (≤)
- One of the holders of parental authority signed the consent
- Patient affiliated to a social security scheme (Social Security or Universal Medical Coverage)
- First episode of bronchiolitis defined by
- Age ≤24 months
- At least one symptom from group A and one symptom from group B Group A (one or more)
- Fever >38 °C
- Cough
- Otalgia
- Nasal congestion
- Rhinorrhea
- Coryza
- Dysphagia Group B (one or more)
- whistling
- Crackles
- Rales
- Decrease in respiratory noise
- Shortness of breath
- Dyspnea
- OR Acute purulent otitis media (Paradise Criteria) or otorrhea.
- OR Pneumonia defined by the presence of opacity of parenchymal condensation and/or pleural effusion on chest X-ray associated with fever
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age >24 months
- Refusal by one of the parents
- Not affiliated to a social security system
